attributes.action: Hold MP's accountable for not upholding the democratic vote to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: We have all seen over the last 3.5 years how parliament, or certain MP's, have behaved because they quite clearly disagree with the vote of the electorate.  We pay these people, we should be able to trust these people to uphold what we decide and not to act against us.  If the peoples democratic vote is not upheld then we have a right to defy the government and denounce their laws re taxes and anything else quite frankly that we disagree with because they have modelled this behaviour to us!
attributes.background: It has been 3.5 years since the British public voted to leave the EU. Certain members of parliament, including the speaker of the house, have done all they possibly can to frustrate and stop this democratic vote being actioned.  These MP's should remember they are voted by the public to work for us!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/257347
